verbose_text: RAD2 C-terminal deletion, which resembles the XPG mutation found in XPG/CS cells, caused cell growth arrest, the cell cycle stalling, a defective alpha-factor response, shortened lifespan, cell polarity defect, and misregulated actin-dynamics after DNA damage.
evidence: RAD2 C-terminal deletion, which resembles the XPG mutation found in XPG/CS cells, caused cell growth arrest, the cell cycle stalling, a defective alpha-factor response, shortened lifespan, cell polarity
